text: president Trump named John Kelly who at
the time was the Secretary of Homeland
Security to be his White House chief of
staff replacing Reince Priebus and
setting a new tone at the White House he
will do a spectacular job I have no
doubt as chief of staff President Trump
likes generals and John Kelly brings a
decade's long storied military career
with a promise of imposing new
military-style discipline on what has
been an unruly and chaotic White House
the two men didn't know each other
before the transition but mr. Kelly is
straight from central casting the kind
of person that fits what mr. Trump
thinks of as a leader for his part mr.
Kelly has talked about being in mr.
Trump's administration as a sense of
service to his country but more than
something for personal loyalty during
his time at Homeland Security he clashed
frequently with the White House over
what he viewed as dysfunction and
improper procedures but he also became a
star in mr. Trump's eyes by cracking
down on illegal immigration principally
we must undertake a rigorous review and
are undertaking a rigorous review of our
immigration vetting programs to increase
our confidence in the decisions we make
relative to visitors and immigrants that
travel to the United States when it
comes to his reputation mr. Kelly has
bipartisan support but he's also been
criticized by some Liberal Democrats and
especially members of the Hispanic
Caucus for what they view as his role at
the Department of Homeland Security in
imposing a far too harsh crackdown on
people who live here illegally and have
come over the border in terms of his
positions on key issues mr. Kelly is at
his core a military man so if President
Trump makes a policy decision mr. Kelly
is like to snap to attention and say yes
sir but friends say he will also not
hesitate to argue with the president
privately and we know that he's already
done that for example on the border wall
where he spent a lot of time trying to
convince mr. Trump that there really is
no need for a massive barrier along the
entire length of the border with Mexico
in terms of what to expect from mr.
Kelly as chief of staff it's likely that
he focuses more on the of staff rather
than the chief his moves so far have
been to impose a bit of discipline
behind the scenes but people I talked to
say he will take his time
the staff and then make changes if he
deems it necessary the big question how
does he deal with people like Ivanka
Trump the president's daughter and
others who he can't fire but he still
needs to keep in line
general Kelly has the full authority to
operate within the White House and all
staff will report to him
[Music]
Oh
